item.description:
Enjoy a day of cross-country skiing or hiking (depending upon weather conditions), at Great Brook Farm in Carlisle, Mass. There are plenty of trails for all levels. The trails are basically flat, so they’re suitable for beginner-level hikers. If participants decide to hike rather than ski, dogs are welcome and leashes are optional. It’s recommended that participants bring a bag lunch including something to drink. There are also plenty of places to eat in nearby Westford.

Trip's Host: Ronn Budd. Best bet is to call Ron at: 978-250-8131 if you have any questions

Meet: At 10 a.m. at Great Brook Farm, 1018 Lowell St., Carlisle, Mass., 01741. Meet at the area of Great Brook Farm that is closest to Concord Road and a large barn. To facilitate finding the group, keep an eye out for Ron's car , which is a grey Toyota Solara, with an event sign on the back. The car will be parked in the lot nearest to the main road. Detailed directions and other information can be found at www.greatbrookski.com.

RSVP: Please RSVP by Feb. 16th Severe weather conditions will cancel the event.

Cost $12 for ski-passes and $13.00 for rentals plus $5 for Meetup members which can be credited towards a full Mosaic membership ($25)

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Cross-Country Skiing or Hiking at Great Brook Farm
